title: Why do scientific journal articles cost money to read? - Quora

response.answer_text: Academic publishing is not free. There are bills to pay. There are employees who deserve to make a living wage, and costs associated with maintaining websites.They don’t always. Open access journals, in which all articles are free to readers, are a thing. And more and more journals are offering open access.Historical inertia. Prior to the rise of the Internet, charging for articles was a highly sensible business model, perhaps the only feasible one.Many academic publishers are for profit companies.

Someone has to pay for the cost of publication and (in many cases) provide profit to commercial publishers. There are 2 options: the author or the reader. In open access journals the author pays and thus the reader doesn't. In the rest of the journals the reader pays. Vast majority of the time it would be not an individual reader but their employer.
